title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**


As **Senior Electrical Engineer** in the Vehicle Hardware team at Voi, you will play a key role in developing the next generation of our vehicles – with a special focus on battery packs, chargers, motors and motor controllers. You will own the electrical perspective across the full product lifecycle: from early concepts and requirements, through design, prototyping, testing and validation, all the way to certification, mass production and in-field quality support.


You will collaborate closely with suppliers (especially in China) and in-house teams such as Firmware, Procurement, QA and Supply Chain to bring robust, safe and high-performing hardware to market.


Key responsibilities include:

* Working with suppliers and internal teams to define requirements, specifications, test plans and designs for new hardware, with a main focus on battery packs but also motors and motor controllers.
* Evaluating supplier solutions through design reviews, lab testing of samples and detailed review and reproduction of supplier test results to verify that specifications are met.
* Designing BMS, motor controllers and other electrical systems on the CAN bus and providing clear feedback and requirements to the Firmware team when software changes are needed.
* Leading suppliers in a structured project format, tracking actions, risks and timelines, and ensuring clear communication and efficient collaboration.
* Providing guidance and ideas for new technical solutions to suppliers – sometimes at a high level, sometimes in detailed electrical design – to help them work effectively towards agreed goals and specifications.
* Supporting the QA team with root cause analysis of complex electrical failures in scooters, e-bikes and batteries, and helping to separate potential causes across firmware, electrical hardware and mechanical interfaces.

**WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK**


You are a hands-on, structured and collaborative electrical engineer who enjoys taking products from idea to mass production. You are comfortable working across requirements, design, testing and validation, and you enjoy partnering with suppliers and cross-functional teams to solve complex problems. We believe you have:

* A degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* End-to-end experience bringing electrical products or systems to market (from concept and requirements to validation and mass production).
* Strong skills in requirement and specification setting, testing and verification of electrical systems.
* Experience with PCB design, ideally for BMS and related systems such as motor controllers and chargers.
* Experience working closely with suppliers (preferably in Asia/China) in a structured project set-up.
* Familiarity with CAN bus systems and interaction between hardware and firmware; experience in firmware is a plus.
* Ability to support structured root cause analysis of complex electrical issues in the field.


Don’t meet every requirement? If you are excited about this role and our mission, and have relevant, transferable skills, we encourage you to apply – even if you don’t check every box.

**WHY VOI?**


Working at Voi is more than just a job; our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:

* Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scale-ups.
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options programme.
* Enjoy unlimited free Voi rides and a dog-friendly office.
* Work together with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal.
* Join the micromobility revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution.

title: AI Software Engineer
description:
**About Qopla**
 Founded by restaurant owners in 2018, Qopla is on a mission to help restaurants streamline their operations. Today, over 2000 restaurants rely on their platform for table ordering, self-service kiosks, and online orders.
   

  

 They’re a tight-knit and innovative team where your work will directly shape their product and impact their partners.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for a Member of Technical Staff to help Qopla explore and build the next generation of intelligent product features.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who is hungry, driven, and comfortable working in areas where not everything is defined yet. You’ll help establish AI capabilities at Qopla and play a key role in shaping how machine learning is used across the product.
   

  

**What You’ll Work On**
 You’ll be involved in designing, building, and iterating on AI-driven solutions, for example:
   

  

* Generative and ML-powered features for customer-facing products, such as menu screens and visual content
* AI-powered support and internal tooling, potentially trained on Qopla’s own data and customer interactions
* Exploring whether solutions should be built from scratch or integrated with existing models and services
* Helping define best practices, trade-offs, and technical direction for AI at Qopla


**Your Responsibilities**
* Design and build AI/ML features that can be used in production
* Manage and lead various POCs and projects within AI/ML
* Evaluate whether problems should be solved with existing models/services or custom-built solutions
* Collaborate with engineers and product to ship features end-to-end


**Qualifications**
* Mid-level to senior experience working with machine learning or applied AI
* Experience building and shipping ML models or AI-based features
* Solid understanding of core AI/ML concepts and trade-offs
* Comfortable working independently and taking ownership of your work
* Fluent in English


**Bonus if you have**
* Experience with generative AI in production
* Experience working in product-focused or startup environments
* Swedish language skills


**Why join Qopla?**
* Be part of an international, close-knit team of developers.
* Work in a collaborative environment where innovation and ownership are encouraged.
* Their hybrid work style offers flexibility, with occasional in-office collaboration to foster strong team connections while maintaining a healthy work-life balance.
* Take on meaningful projects where your expertise will have a direct impact on their success.


 Sound like you? We’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for senior developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


**As a Senior Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:**
* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, or Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, or Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
* You have worked professionally as a Web Developer for at least 5 years.


**Why Umain?**
* Career Framework:


 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

* Work-Life Balance:


 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

* Innovations and Learning:


 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

* Skills Over Degrees:


 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

***Background check***
*Umain conducts a background check for final candidates in accordance with our internal People Procedure (UIS‑007). The check is carried out only with your consent and is ordered by our CISO through our approved screening partner. The scope of the check depends on the role level. This step is performed late in the recruitment process and is used solely to support a secure and fact‑based hiring decision.*
 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Software Engineer UniCore
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.* 




  





**Software Engineer – UniCore Technology (UCT)** 




  





 At MSAB, we’re building the foundational technology that powers the future of mobile forensics and data extraction for law enforcement and intelligence agencies worldwide. Our UniCore Technology (UCT) team is at the very heart of this mission, and we’re looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to help shape what comes next.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Designing and implementing core components that will be used for years to come
* Working across the entire stack – from low-level system code to modern web frontends - Collaborating closely with a small, high-trust team of talented engineers
* Influencing architecture, tooling, and engineering culture



  





**We’d love to meet you if you** 



* Treat programming languages as tools, not tribes – our stack is primarily C/C++/C# with TypeScript for web
* Have strong opinions about what “good code” looks like: simple, readable, performant, and maintainable
* Enjoy solving hard, real-world problems that actually matter



  





**Bonus Points If You Bring Experience With** 



* CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices
* Distributed systems (concurrency, fault tolerance, resilience)
* Cryptology and cryptographic protocols
* Protocol Buffers and gRPC
* Deep Windows and/or Linux systems knowledge



  





**Who You Are** 



* Senior-level expertise in C/C++ and/or C# (we care more about depth than years)
* Self-driven, pragmatic, and low-ego
* Excited by the idea of owning significant parts of a critical codebase
* Eligible to work in Sweden



  





**Why MSAB** 



* Work on technology that has real impact in investigations and public safety
* Small engineering teams = big individual influence
* Solid benefits, and a healthy work-life balance
* Modern office in central Stockholm



  





 You need to have a Swedish or EU Work permit.
 



  





 There is much more to say about our growth plans, strategy, company culture, our values and how we create a safer world. But we save that to the interview.
 



  





 Welcome to apply now!
 



  





 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
 



  





**What we can offer** 




 Create a safer world with us!
 



 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
 



 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
 



 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
 



 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
 



 Are you up for the challenge?
 



 Department Development Role C++ Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Data Engineer till Visma Software Nordic
description:
*Vill du bygga skalbara dataplattformar som gör verklig skillnad i en nordisk SaaS-organisation? Visma Software Nordic söker nu en* 
***Data Engineer***
*som vill vara med och möjliggöra ett datadrivet och AI-redo arbetssätt, tillgängligt för alla hos oss.*
**Om rollen**
 Som Data Engineer ansvarar du för att designa, bygga och förvalta automatiserade och tillförlitliga dataflöden. Ditt arbete minskar manuell rapportering, höjer datakvaliteten och gör data lättillgänglig för hela organisationen.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, med hybrid arbetsmodell.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Bygga och underhålla skalbara ETL/ELT-pipeliner (batch & streaming)
* Integrera data från flera källor (CRM, ERP, produkt- och användardata)
* Bidra till vår gemensamma Lakehouse-plattform (BigQuery)
* Automatisera rapportering och säkerställa hög datakvalitet
* Samarbeta nära olika affärsdomäner på tvärs i hela bolaget såsom som Customer Experience, kommersiella team, Produkt och Finans.
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av GDPR och relevanta standarder.


**Varför Visma Software Nordic?**
 På Visma Software Nordic befinner vi oss i en spännande fas i vår utveckling. 2025 gick våra svenska, norska och danska enheter ihop och bildade Visma Software Nordic. Målet? Att skala upp, växa och ytterligare stärka vår befintliga position som ledande ERP & HRM-aktör i Norden. Idag är vi närmare 900 medarbetare, och tar nu nästa steg i vår transformation mot en datadriven, AI-stärkt organisation.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
* Erfarenhet som Data Engineer eller liknande roll
* Mycket goda kunskaper i SQL och Python
* Kunskap inom datamodellering och ETL/ELT
* Erfarenhet från att ha jobbat med datakvalitet och spårbarhet
* Samarbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska team
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från SaaS eller B2B-miljöer
* Verktyg som dbt, Airflow/Dagster, BigQuery, Looker m.fl
* Vi är en nordisk organisation och du kommer att samarbeta tätt med många kollegor i främst Norge. Förståelse för norska är därför ett stort plus i kanten!


**Vem är du?**
* Du har ett builder-mindset och gillar att skapa robusta lösningar
* Du tar ägarskap och värnar om kvalitet och tillförlitlighet
* Du trivs i tvärfunktionella samarbeten
* Du tar gärna mycket ansvar och har ett starkt eget driv.


**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Vi gillar förändring och att utmana oss! Trots vår storlek och komplexitet med många produkter och affärssystem gillar vi tempo och en entreprenöriell approach till nya utmaningar. Hos oss får du mandat och ansvar att sätta riktningen framåt. Positiva, engagerade och duktiga kollegor som gillar att spela på lag! Givetvis erbjuder vi också kollektivavtal och konkurrenskraftiga förmåner som 30 dagars semester, flexibla extra lediga dagar, semesterlägenheter och cykelleasing, för att nämna några. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök genom att bifoga CV, alternativt länk till uppdaterad LinkedIn-profil. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta: Jonas Vestaberg, +4748109998
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Lead Software Engineer, Back End - L5 (Bangkok based - Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it’s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you’ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**In this Role, you'll get to:**
* Architecting and developing highly scalable, mission critical back end systems
* Owning a big chunk of Agoda’s system all the way from the north-star & vision down to the bytecode level
* Enabling impactful collaboration and cross-team projects on big projects, making a dent in the quality of our services, code & architecture
* Providing thoughtful feedback, nurture an inclusive engineering environment, and champion engineering fundamentals. Bring out the best from your fellow engineers.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities for optimization across the technology stack, focusing on cost, efficiency, velocity & dev happiness
* Exhibiting technical leadership throughout the broader organization, conveying complex technical trade-offs to non-techies such as business owners & C-suite executives.


**What you'll Need to Succeed:**
* Overall experience of 10+ years in software engineering roles
* Proven hands-on experience, Experience with owning production services with significant impact on design, development, deployment, monitoring & evolution
* Curiosity, staying a-breast on technological improvements and open source advancement.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Kotlin, Scala, Java, C#.
* Can perform deep research & take decisions on complex projects. Can easily toggle between running as a lone wolf and also works great as part of a pack
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical details to stakeholders at all levels.
* On top of being an expert in Back End, has understanding of challenges and trade-offs in the entire engineering universe, from Front End/ Mobile to Data Analytics
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand. (Relocation package is provided)**
